metadata.title: CVE-2022-0175 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the VirGL virtual OpenGL renderer (virglrenderer). Thevirgl did not properly initialize memory when allocating a host-backedmemory resource. A malicious guest could use this flaw to mmap from theguest kernel and read this uninitialized memory from the host, possiblyleading to information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0175` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirglrenderer1 - 0.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
virgl-server - 0.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virglrenderer package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.2-1ubuntu1.1').
